messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 178
messages.msgSnippet: ... names! ... My screen name is LouisaM, a reference to Louisa May Alcott.  When I first started using the internet I was told to NEVER give out your real
messages.messageBody:
> He is convinced that those of you who show your names are using fake
names!
> Well are you?

My screen name is LouisaM, a reference to Louisa May Alcott. When I
first started using the internet I was told to NEVER give out your real
name so I used a screen name. I always sign my posts with my real name,
Kris.

I still use the screen name because those who know me via the internet
know me by that. I want to be accountable and easily recognized all
times so I've never changed it. I used to be paranoid about this kind of
thing but time and seratonin boosters have healed that.

Kris

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 178
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/31/2002 1:28:07 PM Pacific Standard Time, ... That s funny. Lots of us know each other. It would be tough to pull that off. I have my full
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/31/2002 1:28:07 PM Pacific Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> He is convinced that those of you who show your names are using fake names!
> Well are you?

That's funny. Lots of us know each other. It would be tough to pull that off.


I have my full name and my phone number listed on the California website
(www.hsc.org). And I get phone calls regularly from people considering
homeschooling. I've never once had ANY problem - my name and number have been
up there for years.

Pam Sorooshian

National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org

HomeSchool Association of California
http://www.HSC.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 178
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/31/2002 1:28:07 PM Pacific Standard Time, ... In California there is an attempt at changing it from six years old to FIVE years old. It
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/31/2002 1:28:07 PM Pacific Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> We have a bill up for vote here in WA right now,
> decreasing the age when compulsory attendance begins
> to 6yrs from 8 yrs.

In California there is an attempt at changing it from six years old to FIVE
years old. It won't have much impact - since 99 percent of people already
think the law says they have to send their kids to kindergarten when they're
five.

--pam


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
